content:
HogEye is best positioned as a wild hog trap release camera system. The operational workflow is monitor, verify, and trigger closure at the right moment.

Why this matters

Most capture failures come from poor timing: early closure, delayed closure, or no closure due to missed alerts. Remote trap monitoring and closure workflows reduce these failures.

Monitor -> verify -> trigger

  • Monitor: maintain active visibility during expected movement windows.
  • Verify: confirm sufficient sounder presence before action.
  • Trigger: close decisively once closure criteria are met.

Reliability factors

  • Low-latency trigger response
  • Signal quality at the trap mount point
  • Power stability during active windows
  • Backup operators for multi-user monitoring

Operational outcome

When the workflow is consistent, teams reduce missed sounders, reduce wasted trips, and improve full-capture rate.
